job description:
Information Sciences Institute (ISI), a unit of USC’s Viterbi School of Engineering, is a world leader in the research and development of advanced information processing, computing, and communications technologies. ISI operates one of the world’s largest academic high-performance computing clusters. ISI has three research campuses: one in Marina Del Rey, CA; one in Arlington, VA; and one in Waltham, MA.

*This position is located in Arlington, VA.*

ISI is home to nearly 250 researchers in a variety of fields, including computational systems and technology, artificial intelligence, and networking, who carry out world-class research in a collaborative, academic environment. ISI scientists have the opportunity to spend the majority of their time doing the research they love. Projects are critically accelerated by research programmers and Ph.D. and M.S. students.

ISI is looking for highly talented and motivated researchers with demonstrated expertise in high performance computing and I/O optimization to join a team developing state-of-the-art high performance cloud and big data systems.

Preferred Qualifications:
  • PhD in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or a related field
  • Experience in performance tuning and optimization with a preferred emphasis on high performance storage
  • Knowledge of systems and familiarity with operating systems internals
  • Good written and oral skills will be necessary to compose technical reports, write peer-reviewed papers, and deliver presentations to sponsors and academic audiences
  • Highly self-motivated, able to set goals, coordinate with teammates, and work semi-autonomously
The selected applicant must obtain and maintain a Top Secret clearance with Sensitive Compartmented Information eligibility and access. Per U.S. government regulations, eligibility for this clearance requires U.S. citizenship.

The University of Southern California values diversity and is committed to equal opportunity in employment.

Minimum Education: Master's degree, Combined experience/education as substitute for minimum education

Minimum Experience: 3 years

Minimum Field of Expertise: Knowledge of research processes and computer science.
